6 September 1960
MEXORANDUM FOR THE RECORD
SUBJECT: Maurice Hyman HALPERIN
(201-129561)
1. On 5 September 1960 an article appeared in The Washington
Post, and Times Herald in which Maurice Hyman HALPERIN was quoted as
saying that the statement issued by the United States Department of
State concerning his employment by the Soviet Government was a "de-
liberate and malicious distortion", HALFERIN was also quoted as
"the American Association" dedicated with the Academy of Sciences of the
USSR, working on a book of the Latin American economics from 1945 to the
"erisis" in 1958, HALFERIN added that he is "not working for the
Soviet Government any more than Van Colburn when he performed in a
government owned concert halls".
2. According to Mr. Lloyd Frank JORAN, Office of Scientific
Intelligence (OSI), 2618 Barton Hall, extension 4201, the Academy
of Sciences of the University subordinate to the USSR Council
of Ministers and it received the Committee on the Committee on
taken by the Academy from the Central Committee of the Committee
Party of the USSR. Mr. JORDAN stated that anyone associated with
the Academy of Sciences of the USSR would be in the employ of the
Soviet Government. Mr. JORDAN said that there are two studies
of the relationship of the Academy of Sciences of the USSR to
the University of the US. OLI-5613/59 which is classified, and
the other a study issued by the U.S. Senate Committee on Government
Operations on "National Policy Machinery in the USSR" which is un-
classified.

OREA-15692, 10 April 1959
1. The following Moscow addresses were found in the pocket notebook
of Amaa Sparer SEBORER; photocopies of Subject's effects were made on
8 April 1959 and were transmitted to headquarters under reference.
a. Prof. Maurice HALEFERN
Ritusevakly Prospekt 13
House 84, Apt 127
Moscow 0-248
b. R. KATZIN
Purmanny Peroulok
House 24, Apt. 21
1. 1959, April 1. No. K 7-2663
c. Ama TELEFRIYA
Maelovka Verkhn. ultsa 7
Apt. 53
Moscow
(Earique de los RIOS)
A Flagging request on the above individuals has been placed with SR/6/63
for-sall coverage, with the understanding the undersigned will be notified
of any letter intercepts.
2. The last known residence of Maurice HALEFERN (201-1248)
vire time Geschiedelovlaia. MEXI 352 (IN 34979), 21 March 1959, 53206 and his
LIVERAT, reports that "on 18 March Anna told Mrs. Albert MALZZ that she had
written Mrs. Maurice HALEFERN telling her not to bother advering but "just
to leave the information for me. HALEZ had heard from HALFERIN and had
"the address" for Anna." This would indicate that Anna SEBORER planned to
get in touch with the RALFERIIS on her recent visit to Moscow, 24 March -
6 April 1959.
17 June 59

1. Attached are the negatives and one set of prints of each of two letters which
vere addressed to Maurice HALFERIN in Mexico.
2. One letter is from a "Ted HALPERIN" and appears to be a personal, family-type
letter. The second letter is from Maurice H. SAVAL and concerns an insurance policy
carried by HALFERIN.
3. ODEWRY has been furnished copies of this correspondence locally.
Hillard
Willard G. CURTIS

SECURITY MATTER - C
Records of the Passport Division, Department
of State, revealed that appointed individual was
issued a passport in August, 1958, at the American
Embassy, kexico City kexico. Regarding her travel
plans, she had previously stated she intended to depart
from kexico on July 12, 1958, for proposed travel to
Europe and the Middle East for the purpose of business
and business. He also noted that the U.S. Department
Embassy advised the Department of State that at the time
a passport was issued to the subject she refused to give
specific travel data but stated she expected to trawl
to Israel, returning via Belgium to visit the World's
Fair at Brussels and would probably stop at intervening
pointe.
Information concerning Halperin has previously
been furnished to the recipients of this letter. No
investigation is requested since this matter is being
handled through the appropriate Legal Attachers. It

DATE OF INFO: 15 - 20 OCTOBER 1958
SUBJECT
: TRAVEL OF MAURICE HYPAN HALPERIN AND WIPE, AMERICAN COMMUNISTS
REFERENCE : OUR TELETYPE MESSAGE OF 18 OCTOBER 1958
1. THE PORTUGUSSÉ INTERHATIONAL POLICE HAVE REDITED THAT MAURICE HYPAN HALPERIN
AND HIS WIFE, WITH FRIISCH HALPERIN, AMERICAN COMMUNISTS WHO ARE SUSPECTED OF BEING
SOUTEY AGENTS, LEFT LISBON FOR ZURICH ON 15 OCTOBER 1958 VIA SWISSAIR AND INDICATED
THAT THEN DESTINATION WAS TEL AVIV. HALPERIN CARRIED U.S. PASSPORT NO. 118071,
WHICH WAS ISSUED IN HEXICO ON 26 AUGUST 1958.
2. AN OFFICIAL SWISS SOURCE REPORTED THAT HALPERIN AND HIS WIPE ARRIVED AT ZURICH
FIRG LISBON ON 15 OCTOBER AND STAYED AT THE HOTEL SCHVEIZERHOP UNTIL 18 OCTOBER, WHEN
THEY TRAVELED TO GEEREVA. THEY EXPECTED TO RETURN TO ZURICH ON 20 OCTOBER.
FIELD DISTRIBUTION: NONE

1. THE PORTUGUESE INTERNATIONAL POLICE HAVE RE-OFTED THAT MAURICE HAYAN HALPERIN
AND HIS LIFE, WITH FISH HALPERI, A-REGIAN CORONNETS INO ARE SUB-CTED OF PILL
SOVIET AGENTS, LEFT LIBBON FOR ZURICH ON 15 OCTOBER 1958 VIA SWISSAN AND INDICATED
THAT THEN DESTINATION WAS TEL AVIV. HALPERIN CARDIED U.S. PASSPORT NO. 118071,
WHICH WAS ISSUED IN MEXICO ON 26 AUGUST 1958.

FIRCH LISBON ON 15 OCTOBER AND STAYED AT THE HOTEL SCHVEIZERHOF UNTIL 18 OCTOBER, WHEN
THEY TRAVELD TO GEEVA. THEY EXPECTED TO RETURN TO ZURICH ON 20 OCTOBER.
